sub_topic: Show that every group of order 40 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C40, the dihedral group D20, or one of the eight non-abelian groups of order 40.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 40, find out which one of the following groups is G isomorphic to: the cyclic group C40, the dihedral group D20, or one of the eight non-abelian groups of order 40? Provide a proof for your answer.

4. If n_2 = 5 and n_5 = 8, then G has five 2-Sylow subgroups of order 8 and eight 5-Sylow subgroups of order 5. In this case, G cannot be isomorphic to the dihedral group D_20, as D_20 has two 5-Sylow subgroups, not eight.
